hypothesis_content.title: Fed Liquidity Injection → Crypto Volatility Compression → Breakout
hypothesis_content.statement: Following a confirmed Fed liquidity injection (TGA drawdown > $10B in a week), crypto aggregate perpetual funding rates will compress to near-zero or negative for 3-5 days, after which a directional breakout (≥5% move) in BTC will occur within the subsequent 48 hours, with the direction favoring the side of the prior regime trend.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Fed liquidity initially reduces systemic stress and dampens speculative positioning (compressing funding). This creates a coiled spring. The subsequent breakout often resumes the underlying trend as new capital seeks direction. The October 'liquidity crash' created a structural low-volatility regime that may be prone to these injections.
entry_conditions: Aggregate Top-10 Crypto Perp Funding Rate (7D MA) compresses to between -0.005% and +0.005% for 3 consecutive days
BTC 20-day Historical Volatility (HV) drops below 40% (compression signal)

exit_conditions.take_profit: BTC price moves ≥5% from entry price in either direction. Enter long if prior 30-day trend was positive (>0), else short.
exit_conditions.stop_loss: BTC price moves 3% against the entered direction.
exit_conditions.time_exit: 48 hours after entry if no breakout occurs.

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Funding compresses but price enters a prolonged, choppy consolidation (>5 days) without a clear ≥5% breakout, or the breakout is immediately reversed (>50% retracement within 12 hours).
